name: drying of protein pea | drying of protein pea | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25009/documentation

The functional unit is one liter of water evaporated. This module should be used when evaluating drying of protein peas from the fresh product to a final product with less moisture content. Only electricity is consumed for this process.;The drying capacity corresponds to the reduction of moisture from 20% to 18%. Drying capacity is assumed to be 80 tonnes of protein peas dried per hour.

The activity starts with the reseption of fresh protein peas with a moisture content of 20%.

This activity ends with the removal of 1 kg of water from the protein peas. The dataset is a service dataset. It includes the energy demand (supplied by consumption of electricity only) for evaporating 1 liter of water. The data for energy demand are based on primary data collection from 20% to <18% of moisture content. Also included in the inventory is the infrastructure (building and machinery) and land use. However, in this dataset just drying burdens are corvered. The dataset does not include waste and air emissions (like dust). Protein pea input, production of the wet educt and utilisation of the dried product are not included as well.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0163:Post-harvest crop activities

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period of the specific electricity data.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Electricity consumption for the process is specific to the protein pea area of production in Canada, in the province of Manitoba.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data are based on smale scale of drying. Drying is taking place with electric fans. Evaporation capacity is assumed to be 80 tonnes.hour-1 of legume.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Lifetime of machinery and building. Only electricity is used for this drying process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The dataset is extrapolated from the "drying of maize grain" in Brazil. Province-pecific electricity consumption data originate from primary data collection.

exchanges.description:
The functional unit is one liter of water evaporated.This dataset is a service dataset. Grain input and utilisation of the dried product are not included.
The grain input and the evaporated water and dried grain outputs need to be added in the dataset which is using this service.

flow.name: drying of protein pea
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0163:Post-harvest crop activities

exchanges.description: The surface area occupied by equipments used for drying was determine by primary data from May et al. (2016). The transformation of the land calculated for one liter of water evaporated, is obtained by dividing this area by the annual yield of dried product and multiplying by drying capacity of the reference product.

The surface area occupied by equipments used for drying was determine by primary data from May et al. (2016). The occupation of the land calculated for one liter of water evaporated, is obtained by dividing this area by the annual yield of dried product and multiplying by drying capacity of the reference product. 2 months is the time occupation of the facility in Canada.

The total amount of electricity consumption is derived from primary data collection that is province specific. For more information please refer to the original publication quoted in this dataset.
EcoSpold01Location=CH
